column4: Does anyone have a guide for starting the xterminal login remotely? I'm logged in through SSH, but can't VNC in. I've seen various "guides" on how to do this but they all involve installing a different vnc server. This seems like a waste because ubuntu already has one if it supports it when logged in.
consider doing ssh -X
can you elaborate? I'm using putty to ssh in.
I use UltraVNC from windows to connect to vino - the ubuntu desktop standard VNC server .... not sure what you are getting at .. or need to do
I do the same. maybe i'm not understanding what ssh -X is, or whether i can do it with putty
I use ultravnc as well, but the vnc server doesn't start up on my machine until someone physically logs in to the machine, ssh'ing doesn't cut it it seems
ssh -X is tunneling X over ssh ... and is very difficult to do in windows .. if you have the resources you could do it in a virtual machine on windows
that's what I thought. Yea i'm stuck with vnc, but i find it hard to believe there's not a way to make the already installed server run with an ssh login instead of installing a secondary server
the already installed server was meant for support/learning purposes, cause by default it is a shared screen, wasn't really meant for admin... although I use it everyday for that
I don't mind if it's a shared screen, i would probably prefer it activate a screen on the server and move the cursor around on it etc.
best bet would to be to leave the remote machine logged in ... just use lock screen when you leave ... when you logon via VNC the machine will come out of lock and be visible until you logout
that works until I remotely run an update and restart it.
